sub_topic: Determining the diameter of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

A - B - C - D - E

Find the diameter of the graph.
message_2:
The diameter of a graph is the longest shortest path between any two vertices in the graph. In this case, the graph is a simple linear graph with vertices A, B, C, D, and E connected in a straight line.

The longest shortest path is between vertices A and E, which is:

A - B - C - D - E

This path has a length of 4, so the diameter of the graph is 4.
